# Introduction

- What is the subject of the study? Describe the economic/econometric problem.
- What is the purpose of the study (working hypothesis)?
- What do we already know about the subject (literature review)? Use citations:
  _@kuncheva2004combining shows that... Alternative Forms of the Wald test are
  considered [@lingenfelser2011systematic]._
- What is the innovation of the study?
- Provide an overview of your results.
- Outline of the paper:\
  _The paper is organized as follows. The next section describes the model
  under investigation. Section \@ref(Data) describes the data set
  and Section \@ref(Results) presents the results. Finally, Section
  \@ref(Conclusion) concludes._
- The introduction should not be longer than 4 pages.
